function_call.name: classify_risks_PESTLE
function_call.arguments: {"sorted_risks":[{"name":"Diminished sense of community in cities","category":"Social risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Neglect of border closure policies by rich urbanites","category":"Political risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Social inequalities and right to housing issues","category":"Social risks","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Inequality and inequitable access to services can put the entire city at risk of further diffusion of the virus.","category":"Social risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Increase in social tensions caused by pandemics, leading to stigmatization and mental health problems for migrant communities.","category":"Social risks","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Diminishing sense of community in some cities due to the pandemic.","category":"Social risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Limited access to medical care for minority groups during pandemics","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Poor living and sanitary conditions in slums leading to difficulty in containing the spread of covid-19","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Lack of access to medical care and basic services in informal developments","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Anthropogenic impacts on water resources","category":"Environmental risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Socio-economic impacts and social consequences of the pandemic","category":"Social risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Drugs used for treatment of covid-19 patients may pollute freshwater resources","category":"Environmental risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Lack of sewage treatment facilities in densely populated areas like india poses challenges for containing the spread of covid-19 through water sources","category":"Infrastructure risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Decrease in tourism activities leading to improved water quality in venice","category":"Environmental risks","confidence":"Low"},{"name":"Air pollution serving as a carrier for the virus","category":"Environmental risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Potential for increased water pollution caused by drugs used for treatment of covid-19 patients","category":"Environmental risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Positive linear relationship between temperature and the number of covid-19 cases","category":"Environmental risks","confidence":"Low"},{"name":"Drier air favors the transmission of the virus","category":"Environmental risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Limited and inconclusive evidence regarding the impact of wind speed on covid-19 infections","category":"Environmental risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Contradictory findings on the correlation between temperature and covid-19 transmission","category":"Environmental risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Negative impact of warm and sunny weather on compliance with ’stay-home’ rules","category":"Social risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Conflicting evidence on the influence of temperature on covid-19 transmission","category":"Environmental risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Limitation of uniform strategies for covid-19 mitigation","category":"Political risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Long-term exposure to pollution increasing vulnerability to covid-19","category":"Environmental risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Secondary impacts of pollution reduction measures and meteorological conditions","category":"Environmental risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Increase in pm concentrations due to domestic heating and industrial activities during lockdown, and long-range transport of particles from neighboring areas.","category":"Environmental risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Significant increases in ozone o3 concentrations due to lower titration of o3 by no and the effects of other meteorological factors.","category":"Environmental risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"High concentration of air pollutants during lockdown period","category":"Environmental risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Limited reduction in pm concentration in some cities","category":"Environmental risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Dominance of environmental quality theme in covid-19 and cities research","category":"Environmental risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Enabling the notification function of scopus to receive weekly publication updates","category":"Technological risks","confidence":"Low"},{"name":"Broad search string may result in irrelevant articles","category":"Technological risks","confidence":"Low"},{"name":"Inaccurate categorization of articles","category":"Data Privacy and Security risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Exclusion of relevant research due to narrow filtering","category":"Technological risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Focus on medical issues may divert understood","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Lack of existing literature review on the impacts of the pandemic on cities","category":"Economic risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"High concentration of people in cities","category":"Social risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Limited literature on cities and pandemics","category":"Economic risks","confidence":"Low"},{"name":"Increased frequency of pandemics due to climate change and human encroachment into wildlife habitats","category":"Environmental risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Lack of discussion on socio-economic and institutional factors impacting resilience building potentials of smart solutions.","category":"Economic risks","confidence":"Low"},{"name":"Inadequate exploration of linkages between smart solutions and multiple resilience abilities.","category":"Economic risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Limited examination of whether deployment of smart solutions may detract from resilience abilities.","category":"Economic risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Smart city technologies may not be uniformly accessible, leading to inequitable distribution of benefits and access to pandemic response tools.","category":"Technological risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Misinformation spread through smart city platforms and technologies may exacerbate the spread of pandemics and hinder control efforts.","category":"Technological risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Dependency on smart city technologies for pandemic response may lead to over-reliance and complacency in traditional public health measures.","category":"Technological risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Smart city infrastructure may lead to increased surveillance and potential invasion of privacy, which can lead to citizen resistance and civil liberties violations.","category":"Technological risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Dependence on smart solutions may lead to digital divide, excluding people and organizations with limited skills and access to technology from pandemic control measures and recovery efforts.","category":"Technological risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Rapid deployment of smart solutions without proper testing and regulation may lead to technological failures, security breaches, and unintended consequences, affecting the effectiveness of pandemic control measures and posing risks to public safety.","category":"Technological risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Teleworking may improve labor productivity through saving travel times.","category":"Economic risks","confidence":"Medium"}]}
